content.content:
`.authentications`

Use the **authentications** resource to create, read, update and delete
admin users in a merchant's store

Users created from this resource should authenticate with API by
[this way](#reference/authenticate-yourself)

description.content: Simple username for identification, only numbers and lowercase letters - Min length: **4** - Max length: **30** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9a-z]+$`**
User language two letter code, sometimes with region, eg.: `pt_br`, fr, `en_us` - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z]{2}(_[a-z]{2})?$`**
User email address - Max length: **200** - Format: **email**
User full name - Max length: **255**
User phone number - Max length: **19** - RegEx pattern: **`^[0-9]+$`**
MD5 hash generated with the user's password - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{32}$`**
List of notifications for current admin user - Max elements: **500**
Unique ID (ObjectID) - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
Date and time of the notified event, in the ISO 8601 standard representation - Format: **date-time**
Whether notification was read
Notification urgency type (and color)
Content for notification body - Min properties: **1**
Default notification text translations, optional if API event is specified - Max properties: **10**
Translated notification text - Max length: **255**
Store API event related to current notification
Type of action taken
Related API resource
Related resource ID (to be linked) - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
User preferences in the admin dashboard - Max properties: **100**
Boolean option value
Keyboard shortcuts, keys separated by `+` as property name - Max properties: **100**
Shortcut JS (or jQuery) action - Min length: **3** - Max length: **255**
Number of random cards to show on dashboard home
List of dashboard cards chosen by user - Max elements: **40**
Unique ID (ObjectID) - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-f0-9]{24}$`**
Unique identifier, card name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore - RegEx pattern: **`^[a-z0-9_]{2,60}$`**
Card title - Max length: **70**
Card text, usually a brief description - Max length: **255**
Custom card calling MongoDB aggregate
API resource
Aggregation pipeline - Min elements: **1** - Max elements: **50**
List of dashboard dismissed cards, by `card_id` - Max elements: **300**
Unique identifier, card name using only lowercase, numbers and underscore
Custom (user-selected) fields to display on dashboard forms, resource as property name - Max properties: **20**
List of chosen resource properties (fields) - Max elements: **200**
Resource property name with dot notation for nested object
Whether the user is able to use builder and file manager to edit storefront
Flags to associate additional info - Max elements: **10**
Flag title
Optional notes with additional info about this user - Max length: **255**

content.content:
*/authentications.json* > Authentication
_GET_, _POST_: **required** Pagination, filtering and ordering are not available, you should not use any URL parameters List returns only `_id`, `username`, `email` and `app` (in case of application auth) of each authentication To create new authentication, request body must obey the specifications of [this model](#reference/authentications/authentication-object)

*/authentications/[_id].json* > Authentication
_GET_, _PATCH_, _DELETE_: **required** In read requests, response body will follow [this model](#reference/authentications/authentication-object), without `pass_md5_hash` property It's possible to use __me__ on resource ID (*/authentications/me.json*) to work with your own authentication (see [Yourself](#reference/authentications/yourself)) For editing, request body must obey the same specifications, but in this case there are no required fields

description.content: The authentication ID
The authentication ID
The authentication ID

content.content:
*/authentications/me.json* > Authentication
_GET_, _PATCH_, _DELETE_: **required** At this endpoint you will work with the same authentication of _X-My-ID_ header In read requests, response body will follow [this model](#reference/authentications/authentication-object), without `pass_md5_hash` property For editing, request body must obey the same specifications, but in this case there are no required fields
